benchmark_details.name: AURA (Audio-visual Understanding and Reasoning Assessment)
benchmark_details.overview: AURA is the first question-answering benchmark designed to evaluate the reasoning capabilities of Audio-Visual Large Language Models (AV-LLMs) and Omni-Modal Language Models (OLMs) on fine-grained cognitive tasks, including Cross-Modal Causal Reasoning, Timbre/Pitch Reasoning, Tempo/AV Synchronization Analysis, Unanswerability, Implicit Distractions, and Performer Skill Profiling.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the cross-modal, audio-visual reasoning performance of state-of-the-art models on six fine-grained cognitive tasks.

data.source: Multiple sources including FineVideo dataset, MUSIC-A VQA dataset, and custom YouTube videos.
data.annotation: Automatically generated via a modular QA generation pipeline utilizing large language models.

methodology.calculation: FCS evaluates if reasoning is factually grounded, while CIS assesses logical validity of reasoning.
methodology.interpretation: Higher FCS and CIS scores indicate better reasoning quality in audio-visual context.
methodology.baseline_results: Various state-of-the-art models evaluated with varying performance across AURA tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluation includes comparison against ground-truth reasoning.
